Description:
Main Duties & ResponsibilitiesResearch, Write, translate and adapt items, news stories or programme material and to edit packages at the desktop.
To keep up to date with main news stories and undertake background research and checking on factual information.
Flexible and prepared to take on any role required by the Editor or senior team members in response to the needs of the Newsroom (Input and Output).
Occasional deployment in the field for specific projects requiring technical expertise and editorial judgement.
Manage a moving story, amending and updating material as required to build compelling and engaging news material
Liaise with assignment desk and producers, to gather information and advice on stories and coverage.
Provide ideas and suggestions for output, stories and attend editorial meetings when required.
Manage and undertake pre and post production and studio work, both live and pre-recorded.
To produce graphics at the desktop and in collaboration with graphic designers.
To be familiar with different technical systems, including news production systems, demonstrate a willingness to learn to operate new technology systems and to be able to adapt to different working methods.Skills
Skills:
Able to work with minimum supervision within a fast paced environment and achieve objectives.
Works with precision, accuracy and applies a high attention to detail.
Effective communications and presentation skills using multimedia tools.
Proven Analytical, conceptual and problem-solving skills, work under pressure and to tight deadlines.
A full command and up to date knowledge of spoken and written modern standard Arabic language of a high standard.
Able to write, adapt and translate with accuracy, clarity and style as appropriate to different audience groups and media groups and articulate and able to communicate effectively at a professional broadcasting standard.
Up to date knowledge of regional and international news.
Appreciates and understands the benefits and importance of social media and digital technologies.
Excellent understanding of editorial guidelines and able to identify trends and potential issues.
Dealing with live ‘breaking news’ and developing ideas resulting in turning into successful creative programme with speed.
Able to demonstrate a very good understanding of news and current affairs programmes and the types of audiences they attract.
